page.title: 07RELIGION. PARISH CHURCH.
page.content: In a loop of road off the Birm'ham Rd. stands{St.Laurence's Church}Meriden.It commands extensive views across the Warwickshire countryside,on clear days you can see beyond Birmingham city to the Clent Hills & Barr Beacon.The building has a Norman chancel,the nave dating from 13th-15th century.The tower has 5 bells,each with an inscription & a clock whose tick echoes around the church.Groats & 1/2 groats (Richard 111) decorate the oldest bell & the youngest was cast to celebrate 60yrs of Queen Victoria's reign.In the chancel floor is a memorial brass, dated 1638, to Elizabeth Rotton,also to be seen are a'squint'(hagioscope) & 2 monuments supporting stone knights on.Outside the church is a sundial made from a stone cross. In the lane are fine examples of 17th/18th farm houses.
